p: Many of the fundamental epidemiological features of LBMs remain poorly understood. These factors include: the physical layouts of the markets, the holding capacity of different markets, how far birds travel to come to market, how long different types of birds stay in the market, and the rate and frequency with which birds are sold onwards from the market [ 33, 34]. Furthermore, the actual size of the market from which the data analysed here was collected remains unknown, but is likely to impact the dynamics of infection, as demonstrated by our analysis.
